TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit LogArchiveSnapshot extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents a snapshot of the instance that can be used to generate an archive.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A <xref:System.IO.Log.LogArchiveSnapshot> object contains the information necessary to generate a consistent backup of the data in a <xref:System.IO.Log.LogStore>. The actual data is contained in the enumerable collection of <xref:System.IO.Log.FileRegion> objects returned by the <xref:System.IO.Log.LogArchiveSnapshot.ArchiveRegions%2A> property. Each <xref:System.IO.Log.FileRegion> instance represents a sequence of bytes in a file that must be archived.
The <xref:System.IO.Log.LogArchiveSnapshot.ArchiveTail%2A>, <xref:System.IO.Log.LogArchiveSnapshot.BaseSequenceNumber%2A>, and <xref:System.IO.Log.LogArchiveSnapshot.LastSequenceNumber%2A> properties are for informational purposes only. They can be recorded along with the archive data to provide optional information, but are not required to restore the data.
## Examples The following example shows how to use the <xref:System.IO.Log.LogArchiveSnapshot> class to archive a <xref:System.IO.Log.LogStore> to an XML document.
[!code-csharp[logarchievesnapshot#0](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/logarchievesnapshot/cs/logarchievesnapshot.cs#0)] [!code-vb[logarchievesnapshot#0](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/logarchievesnapshot/vb/logarchievesnapshot.vb#0)]

Docs.summary: Gets an enumerable collection of instances containing the actual archival data.
Docs.value: An enumerable collection of instances containing the actual archival data.
